intro: Rinorea pilosa, commonly known as the silky mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and clusters of small, pale pink or white flowers. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like cotton and hibiscus. Rinorea pilosa typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
